H0.text: Density is the property most likely to remain constant in different samples of the same material, because materials made of the same substance share common characteristics.

H1.text: Mass is the property most likely to remain constant in different samples of the same material, as materials made of the same substance have characteristics in common.

H2.text: Shape is the property most likely to remain constant in different samples of the same material, as materials made of the same substance will have characteristics in common.

H3.text: Volume is the property most likely to remain constant in different samples of the same material, as materials made of the same substance will have characteristics in common.

A4.text: Density is an intensive property in that increasing the amount of a substance does not increase its density; rather it increases its mass.

A5.text: The density of a material varies with temperature and pressure.

A7.text: Mass is an intrinsic property of a body.

A8.text: An object on the Moon would weigh less than it does on Earth because of the lower gravity, but it would still have the same mass.
